short_summary: Introducing the Innovative Solutions Canada Program (ISC) Call for Proposals which has been looking for photonics innovation to put Canada on the map in the international photonics market.
description: The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) is seeking innovative solutions that will assist in developing a new technology for high accuracy spectral measurement and time division multiplexing for sensing, logistics, mobility, and processing for energy production and storage systems. This technology is intended for inspection and monitoring the integrity of structural components and measuring of numerous engineering and physical properties at high accuracy.
duration_in_months: When the duration is not specified, the behaviour of the null value of a Date object is used, according to the doc for datetime.timedelta(). The null value of a Date object is treated as 0 days. Therefore, when the duration is not specified, the expected duration is 0 months

full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement: Optical Fiber Sensor Interrogator

### Tender Title: Optical Fiber Sensor Interrogator
#### Tender Number: cb-424-33192097

The [PSPC/SPAC](#contracting-Entity) invites interested suppliers to participate in a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the development of an Optical Fiber Sensor Interrogator.

### Tender Details

* **Solicitation Number:** EN578-20ISC3
* **Solicitation Date:** 2023-10-04
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2023-11-15T14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** Not specified
* **Expected Contract End Date:** Not specified
* **Current Status:** Expired

### Background and Context

The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) is seeking a solution to develop an Optical Fiber Sensor Interrogator capable of interrogating hundreds to thousands of Fiber Bragg Grating (FBG) sensors present on a single optical fiber. The interrogator must have the capability to discriminate individual FBG reflection wavelengths and determine their location via time-of-flight measurements.

### Tender Requirements

The proposed solution must:

1.	Have the dual capability of discriminating an individual FBG reflection wavelength from other FBGs (wavelength division multiplexing – WDM) as well as determining the FBG location via time-of-flight measurements (time division multiplexing-TDM)
2.	Wavelength range in the telecom C-band (1528 to 1568 nm)
3.	Output power: > 13 dBm
4.	Laser linewidth: < 10 MHz
5.	Wavelength accuracy: < ± 5pm
6.	Wavelength tuning repeatability: < ± 5 pm
7.	Laser tuning step resolution: 8 pm
8.	Output channels: at least 16
9.	Input channels (return fibers): at least 16
10.	Laser scanning rate: 1 Hz to 200 kHz
11.	Laser optical interface: FC/APC
12.	Self-calibrated wavelength with internal reference
13.	Have ethernet or WiFi communication interfaces

### Project Phases

*	Phase 1: Up to 6 months. Maximum funding available: $150,000.00 CAD excluding applicable taxes, shipping, travel and living expenses, as required. Estimated number of Phase 1 contracts: 2.
*	Phase 2: Up to 24 months.
